_field_real.name: PVS bounding box extension factor #How much we extend the PVS region around the objects AABB : [good initial value 2.5]

_field_real_vector_3d.name: PVS block size #How big a single PVS block is, in world units : [good initial value (2.0,2.0,2.0)]

_field_long_integer.name: PVS sampling subdivision per axis #How many sample subdivisions we perform per PVS block when generating the data : [good initial value 2]

_field_real.name: PVS visibility threshold #Minimum amount we need to see of an individual part mesh to care about it : [good initial value 0.004]
shadow fade distance:world units#NOTE this is only a maximum distance, shadows may fade closer when you exceed the shadow budget, you should balance the total shadows in a scene
midrange detail disappear distance:world units#distance at which the midrange detail disappears
close detail disappear distance:world units#distance at which the close detail disappears

_field_string_id.name: region name^:must match region name in render_model

_field_short_enum.name: sort order#negative values mean closer to the camera

_field_string_id.name: parent controlling seat label^#the seat in my parent that will control me

_field_long_block_index.name: instance group#selects an instance group for this variant

_field_block.name: muted nodes#turn off animation on these named nodes and children

_field_string_id.name: node name^:must match node name in render_model

_field_long_block_index.name: subgroup#if this member is chosen, this subgroup will be chosen as well

_field_string_id.name: instances#instance name, a partial name will choose all matching instances, leave blank for NONE

_field_real.name: probability:> 0.0#higher numbers make it more likely

item.Name: parent never takes body damage for us
parent never takes shield damage for us
AI do not damage without player
shield recharge plays only when empty
orphan from postprocess autogen#check this to take control of the new damage info tag block

_field_string_id.name: global indirect material name#absorbes AOE or child damage

_field_custom_short_block_index.name: indirect damage section#absorbes AOE or child damage

_field_real.name: minimum stun damage#the minimum damage required to stun this object's health
stun time:seconds#the length of time the health stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage
recharge time:seconds#the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted

_field_real_fraction.name: recharge fraction#0 defaults to 1 - to what maximum level the body health will be allowed to recharge

_field_real.name: maximum shield vitality#the default initial and maximum shield vitality of this object
minimum stun damage#the minimum damage required to stun this object's shields
stun time:seconds#the length of time the shields stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage
recharge time:seconds#the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted
shield overcharge fraction#fraction to which shields will automatically overcharge, values <= 1.0 are ignored
shield overcharge time#time it takes to reach full "shield overcharge fraction"

_field_block.name: damage sections
_field_block._field_explanation: * absorbs body damage: damage to this section does not count against body vitality * headshottable: takes extra headshot damage when shot * ignores shields: damage to this section bypasses shields

item.Name: takes full dmg when object dies
takes full dmg when obj dstryd
takes full dmg when shield depl

_field_real_fraction.name: vitality percentage:[0.1]#percentage of total object vitality

_field_block.name: instant responses
_field_block._field_explanation: * if you specify a constraint group name (see lower section of this block) you can specify a constraint damage * loosening a constraint takes it out of the rigid state - activates it * destroying a constraint sets the attached body free

item.Name: destroy one of group#sets the attached body of this constraint free
destroy entire group#sets the attached body of all constraints free
loosen one of group#takes this constraint out of the rigid state - activates it
loosen entire group#takes all constraints out of the rigid state - activates them

_field_block._field_explanation: - a response can destroy a single constraint by naming it explicitly. - alternatively it can randomly destroy a single constraint from a specified group if the "destroy one group constraint" flag is set - also it can destroy all constraints in a specified group if the "destroy all group constraints" flag is set

* kills object: when the response fires the object dies regardless of its current health * inhibits <x>: from halo 1 - disallows basic behaviors for a unit * forces drop weapon: from halo 1 - makes the unit drop its current weapon * kills weapon <x> trigger: destroys the <x> trigger on the unit's current weapon * destroys object: when the response fires the object is destroyed

item.Name: kills object#when the response fires the object dies regardless of its current health
inhibits melee attack#from halo 1 - disallows melee for a unit
inhibits weapon attack#from halo 1 - disallows weapon fire for a unit
inhibits walking#from halo 1 - disallows walking for a unit
forces drop weapon#from halo 1 - makes the unit drop its current weapon
destroys object#when the response fires the object is destroyed
damages weapon primary trigger#destroys the primary trigger on the unit's current weapon
damages weapon secondary trigger#destroys the secondary trigger on the unit's current weapon

_field_real_fraction.name: damage threshold#response fires after crossing this threshold. 1=full health

item.Name: body threshold active#this resoponse fires when the body healh fraction crosses this boundary

_field_real.name: body damage threshold#response fires after object body damage crosses this threshold, numbers can be negative. You need to set the flag "body threshold active" for this number to be used. 1=full health

_field_short_block_index.name: destroy instance group#all possible instances from this group will be destroyed

_field_block._field_explanation: If desired, you can specify a delay until the response fires.This delay is pre-empted if another timed response for the same section fires.The delay effect plays while the timer is counting down.If the damage threshold is taken in a single hit while counting down, it will prematurely fire.
when this response fires, any children objects created at the supplied marker name will be destroyed
scale on total damage section vitality

_field_block.name: region-specific-damage
_field_block._field_explanation: for fields below, 0.0==inherit from damage seat

item.Name: takes damage for children#useful for bipeds shielding/taking damage for weapons
parent never takes damage for us#useful for attached shields

_field_real.name: maximum vitality#value of zero implies 'damage sections' should be empty

_field_string_id.name: indirect material name#absorbes AOE or child damage

_field_short_block_index.name: indirect damage section#absorbes AOE or child damage
shielded state damage section#the model's shielded/unshielded state reflects the depletion of this damage section

item.Name: starts inactive#this section will be initialized with zero health and will be stunned indefinitely
takes full dmg when object dies
takes full dmg when obj dstryd
headshot#takes extra headshot damage when shot
play recharge effect only when empty
networked (note that primary body and shield are always networked)
can recharge independently#always a shield layer to recharge even if there is an inner shield layer that is stunned

_field_real_fraction.name: vitality percentage:[0.1]#percentage of total object vitality

_field_string_id.name: shield material name#set this to make this damage section a shield

_field_real.name: minimum stun damage#the minimum damage required to stun this object's health

_field_real_fraction.name: vitality percentage:[0.1]#recharge will stop once this percentage of vitality is reached.

_field_real.name: pre recharge effect warn time:seconds#(main shield only) how long before the recharge begins the pre-recharge effect fires

_field_string_id.name: pre recharge effect marker#(main shield only)

_field_tag_reference.name: pre recharge abort effect#(main shield only) if the pre-recharge effect is aborted before the actual recharge starts, this effect plays

_field_string_id.name: pre recharge abort effect marker#(main shield only)

_field_real.name: overcharge time:seconds#time it takes to reach full "overcharge fraction"
overcharge fraction#fraction to which shields will automatically overcharge, values <= 1.0 are ignored
pre decay time:seconds#time for this section to be active before it will start to decay
decay time:seconds#time for need for this section to fully decay with full health.

item.Name: kills object#when the response fires the object dies regardless of its current health
inhibits melee attack#from halo 1 - disallows melee for a unit
inhibits weapon attack#from halo 1 - disallows weapon fire for a unit
inhibits walking#from halo 1 - disallows walking for a unit
forces drop weapon#from halo 1 - makes the unit drop its current weapon
destroys object#when the response fires the object is destroyed
damages weapon primary trigger#destroys the primary trigger on the unit's current weapon
damages weapon secondary trigger#destroys the secondary trigger on the unit's current weapon
can refire#can fire again if the section ever recharges past its threshold
can skip transition effects#will not spawn effects if previous response also fired

hides object if destroyed by response on predicted client#if the destroys object flag and this flag are both checked, the object will be hidden on predicted clients when the response fires (hologram hack)

_field_real_fraction.name: damage threshold#response fires after crossing this threshold. 1=full health

_field_tag_reference.name: looping effect#will play until the next response is triggered.

_field_short_block_index.name: destroy instance group#all possible instances from this group will be destroyed

_field_real.name: response delay:seconds#time to wait until firing the response. This delay is pre-empted if another timed response for the same section fires.

_field_tag_reference.name: delay effect#plays while the timer is counting down

_field_real_fraction.name: skip fraction#0.0 always fires, 1.0 never fires

_field_string_id.name: destroyed child object marker name#when this response fires, any children objects created at the supplied marker name will be destroyed

_field_real_fraction.name: total damage threshold#scale on total damage section vitality

_field_string_id.name: constraint/group name#can specify a randomly-selected single constraint or the entire group of named constraints

item.Name: destroy one of group#sets the attached body of this constraint free
destroy entire group#sets the attached body of all constraints free
loosen one of group#takes this constraint out of the rigid state - activates it
loosen entire group#takes all constraints out of the rigid state - activates them

_field_string_id.name: marker name^#multiple markers become multiple spheres of the same radius

_field_angle.name: cone angle#the target is only visible when viewed within this angle of the marker's x axis

_field_custom_short_block_index.name: damage section#the target is associated with this damage section

_field_short_block_index.name: variant#the target will only appear with this variant

_field_real_fraction.name: targeting relevance#higher relevances turn into stronger magnetisms

item.Name: use for network lead vector only

_field_string_id.name: tracking type#a weapon can track/lock on this target if this string is in the weapon's tracking block

item.Name: shows tracking reticle#use this model targets center for displaying the targetting reticle

_field_tag_reference.name: default dialogue#The default dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)
default dialogue female#The default FEMALE dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)

item.Name: inconsequential target#used in magnetism and campaign saving
model use airprobe lighting first{model use airprobe lighting}
locked precomputed probes#air or scenery probe
If sky attaches to camera#parallax % between sky pos and camera pos below

_field_string_id.name: default dialogue effect#The default dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)

_field_block.name: scenario load parameters
_field_block._field_explanation: strip-variant <variant-name> strips a given variant out of the model tag strip-dialogue strips all the dialogue for this model i.e. cinematic only

_field_real_fraction.name: Sky parallax percent#If flag checked % between sky pos and camera pos 0=camera

_field_real.name: shadow slope scale bias:degrees#controls cutoff point for shadows around edges. Default is 81 degrees
shadow depth compare bias (dynamic lights)#Default is 0.0008
shadow slope scale bias (dynamic lights):degrees#controls cutoff point for shadows around edges. Default is 81 degrees

plugin._field_explanation:
By default, the shadows on each permutation are computed using the first permutation in every other region as shadow casters. You can override this behavior below by specifying which permutation to use as a shadow caster in a given region.
PRT shadow bounces: the number of light bounces to use when computing the global illumination. (0 bounces gets only direct light). Increasing the number of bounces increases the calculation time. 1 or 2 bounces should be good enough for almost all models.

_field_char_enum.name: PRT shadow detail!#how much information is recorded about different light directions
PRT shadow bounces#0 means direct light only

_field_string_id.name: shadow cast permutation#leave blank for none

item.Name: PRT shadows from all regions (default permutations)
PRT self-shadow only (no shadows from other regions)
No PRT shadows at all (probably not useful)

plugin._field_explanation: Regular and 1st person shield impact effect overrides
